contentrichtext.text: <!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:Napoleon_Disentimed_British.jpg|thumb|200px|left|The British edition of ''Napoleon Disentimed'', 1989]] --> [[Image:Napoleon Disentimed Russian.jpg|thumb|200px|right|The Russian edition of ''Napoleon Disentimed'', 1997]] '''''Napoleon Disentimed''''' is a [[science fiction]] [[novel]] by [[Hayford Peirce]] first published by [[Tor Books]] in 1987. It is a humorous treatment of two standard science-fiction themes, those of [[time travel]] and of [[Parallel universe (fiction)|parallel universe]]s. The protagonist is a dapper, clever [[confidence trick|con man]] who, although born to humble origins in [[Bangor, Maine]], [[United States]], calls himself Sir Kevin Dean de Courtney MacNair of MacNair. Through a complicated series of misadventures he ends up impersonating [[Napoleon]] [[Bonaparte]] for the dictator's so-called "Missing Years", 1806-1808. By the end of the book he has succeeded in not only acquiring a beautiful wife and a slightly run-down château in France but in also inventing both the modern indoor [[flush toilet]] and [[Champagne (wine)|Champagne]]. A sequel to ''Napoleon Disentimed'', also featuring the MacNair, is ''[[The Burr in the Garden of Eden]]''. ==Editions== ===British edition=== *''Napoleon Disentimed'', Bantam Books, 1989, ISBN 1-58715-267-3 ===Italian edition=== *''La Scacchiera del Tempo'', in ''[[Urania (magazine)|Urania]]'' n. 1135, [[Arnoldo Mondadori|Mondadori]], 1990 ===German edition=== *''Der Zeitgereiste Bonaparte'', Heyne, 1992 ===Russian edition=== *''Наполеон вне Времени'', Armada, 1997, ISBN 5-7632-0421-2 [[Category:1987 novels]] [[Category:1980s science fiction novels]] [[Category:American science fiction novels]] [[Category:Time travel novels]]
